revised_title: Flow Dynamics of Liquid Helium Films
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the flow of liquid helium films and found that the rate of flow varies with the film's thickness and height. The results provide insights into the hydrodynamics of the superfluid component and challenge the concept of a critical velocity in the flow of liquid helium. The findings suggest that the flow of the superfluid component may not be truly frictionless, and there may be small dissipative forces at play.
